title: Evacuations Ordered as Fire Breaks Out in Laguna Beach
content: Residents were being evacuated in Laguna Beach as a brush fire broke out and quickly grew to 25 acres.    The wind-driven blaze began as a half-acre brush fire but quickly grew as it burned in the Aliso Woods Canyon behind Soka University, according to the Orange County Fire Authority.    Residents in the Top of the World neighborhood in Laguna Beach were being evacuated as 130 firefighters responded to the fire.    This is a developing story. Refresh this page for updates.
